title: LSU's Les Miles hopes to play villain in film opposite Tom Cruise
text:
LSU's Les Miles hopes to play villain in film opposite Tom Cruise Miles hopes to play villain in film opposite Hollywood star Tom Cruise. Oct 19, 2015 at 7:16p ET 0Shares 
Iconic actor Tom Cruise was in attendance for LSU's victory over Florida in Tiger Stadium this past weekend. Sitting in AD Joe Alleva's booth, Cruise watched Leonard Fournette rush for 180 yards and Brandon Harris toss two touchdowns in the 35-28 victory. 
While Cruise was enjoying some high-quality SEC football, was he also scouting talent for his next film? Miles: "How about Tom Cruise being at the game? My daughter saw him. I'd be a good bad guy I think in a Jack Reacher movie." Priceless. #LSU â€” Scott Rabalais (@RabalaisAdv) October 19, 2015 
LSU coach Les Miles threw his hat into the ring during his Monday news conference. According to Miles, "I'd be a good 'bad guy' I think in a Jack Reacher movie." 
The average movie villain is generally cunning, intelligent, calculated and a bit eccentric. Based on Miles' "Mad Hatter" persona, he may fit the bill quite well in this capacity. MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters. 0
